BR_text.BRsummary: Coming PIP updates causes installation issues
BR_text.BRdescription:
<denchmark-h:h3>My actions before raising this issue</denchmark-h>
 
 
  Read/searched the docs
  Searched past issues
 
 When I install pip dependencies, it successful and pip says:
 <denchmark-code>ERROR: After October 2020 you may experience errors when installing or updating packages. This is because pip will change the way that it resolves dependency conflicts.
 We recommend you use --use-feature=2020-resolver to test your packages with the new resolver before it becomes the default.
 astroid 2.4.2 requires lazy-object-proxy==1.4.*, but you'll have lazy-object-proxy 1.5.1 which is incompatible.
 </denchmark-code>
 
 I tried to use this flag and installation was failed with the error:
 <denchmark-code>ERROR: Cannot install lazy-object-proxy==1.5.1 and -r cvat/requirements/development.txt (line 2) because these package versions have conflicting dependencies.
 
 The conflict is caused by:
     The user requested lazy-object-proxy==1.5.1
     astroid 2.4.2 depends on lazy-object-proxy==1.4.*
 
 To fix this you could try to:
 1. loosen the range of package versions you've specified
 2. remove package versions to allow pip attempt to solve the dependency conflict
 
 ERROR: ResolutionImpossible: for help visit https://pip.pypa.io/en/latest/user_guide/#fixing-conflicting-dependencies
 </denchmark-code>
 
 Probably need to fix it ASAP to escape possible future issues of our users.
 <denchmark-h:h3>Context</denchmark-h>
 
 <denchmark-h:h3>Your Environment</denchmark-h>
 
 
 Git hash commit (git log -1): 5d09639
 Docker version docker version (e.g. Docker 17.0.05): N/A
 Are you using Docker Swarm or Kubernetes? No
 Operating System and version (e.g. Linux, Windows, MacOS): Ubuntu 18.04
